skill.name: screenshot-feature-extractor
skill.description: Analyze product screenshots to extract feature lists and generate development task checklists. Use when: (1) Analyzing competitor product screenshots for feature extraction, (2) Generating PRD/task lists from UI designs, (3) Batch analyzing multiple app screens, (4) Conducting competitive analysis from visual references.
skill.summary: Analyze product screenshots to extract feature lists and generate development task checklists. Use w...
skill.author: notedit

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Orchestrates AI agents via the Task tool to analyze screenshots. Only reads user-provided files and writes output to a predictable location. No network calls, no command execution, no env access.

content.value_statement: Analyzing screenshots manually to extract features and create task lists is time-consuming and error-prone. This multi-agent skill analyzes UI screenshots in parallel from three perspectives to identify features, interactions, and business logic, then generates a ready-to-use development task checklist.
actual_capabilities: Analyze UI components, layout structure, and design patterns from screenshots
Identify user interactions, navigation flows, and state transitions
Extract business functions, data entities, and domain logic
Synthesize parallel analyses into a unified feature list
Generate development task checklists with checkbox format
Review output for completeness and quality validation
limitations: Only analyzes image files, not design files like Figma or Sketch
Cannot interact with live applications or websites
Requires clear, readable screenshots for accurate analysis
Output quality depends on screenshot clarity and context provided

use_cases.title: Create requirements from mockups
use_cases.description: Turn UI mockups or screenshots into feature specs and task lists for engineering teams

use_cases.title: Understand feature scope quickly
use_cases.description: Analyze competitor apps or reference designs to understand feature scope before implementation

use_cases.title: Document existing products
use_cases.description: Reverse-engineer existing products by analyzing their screens to document capabilities

prompt_templates.title: Basic screenshot analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this screenshot and extract all visible features, UI components, and interactions. Output file: docs/plans/YYYY-MM-DD-app-features.md

prompt_templates.title: Multi-screen analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze multiple screens from same app
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these screenshots from the same application. Identify all features across screens and create a consolidated task list. Deduplicate similar features.

prompt_templates.title: Competitive analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these competitor screenshots. Identify unique features and gaps compared to our product. Create a feature comparison matrix with development task priorities.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed feature breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform deep analysis on this screenshot. Break down each feature into 3-5 granular subtasks focusing on user interactions and business logic. Output detailed development checklist.

output_examples.input: Analyze this dashboard screenshot and create a feature task list
output: User Authentication module: Login screen, Remember me, Password reset
Dashboard Overview module: Stats cards, Real-time data, Date range picker
Navigation module: Sidebar menu, Breadcrumbs, User menu dropdown
Reporting module: Export PDF, Date filter, Graph visualization

best_practices: Provide context about the product purpose and target users for better analysis
Use high-resolution screenshots with clear text for accurate feature detection
Include multiple related screens to capture navigation and state transitions
Review and validate generated tasks against actual requirements
anti_patterns: Using low-resolution or blurry screenshots that obscure UI details
Analyzing screenshots without providing product context or user goals
Expecting implementation-level details like tech stack or database schema
Skipping the review phase when accuracy is critical

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: PNG, JPG, and common image formats are supported. Use high-resolution images for best results.

faq.question: How many screenshots can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: No strict limit, but best results come from 3-10 related screens for comprehensive feature coverage.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my design tools?
faq.answer: Export screenshots from Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD as PNG/JPG files before analysis.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens locally through Claude Code. Screenshots are not uploaded to external services.

faq.question: Why are my screenshots not detecting features accurately?
faq.answer: Ensure screenshots are high-resolution, well-lit, and include relevant context. Add product details in your prompt.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual feature mapping?
faq.answer: This skill uses multiple AI agents in parallel for faster, more comprehensive analysis with consistent output format.
